sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has a length of 10 cm, a width of 7 cm and a height of 6 cm. What is the length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism?
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. The formula is:

Diagonal length = √(length² + width² + height²)

Given the dimensions of the rectangular prism:
Length = 10 cm
Width = 7 cm
Height = 6 cm

Plugging these values into the formula:

Diagonal length = √(10² + 7² + 6²)
Diagonal length = √(100 + 49 + 36)
Diagonal length = √185

The length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism is √185 cm, which is approximately 13.60 cm.
